1.text: Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of [the] heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession, Jesus,

2.text: who is faithful to him that has constituted him, as Moses also in all his house.

3.text: For he has been counted worthy of greater glory than Moses, by how much he that has built it has more honour than the house.

4.text: For every house is built by some one; but he who has built all things [is] God.

5.text: And Moses indeed [was] faithful in all his house, as a ministering servant, for a testimony of the things to be spoken after;

6.text: but Christ, as Son over his house, whose house are we, if indeed we hold fast the boldness and the boast of hope firm to the end.

7.text: Wherefore, even as says the Holy Spirit, To-day if ye will hear his voice,

8.text: harden not your hearts, as in the provocation, in the day of temptation in the wilderness;

9.text: where your fathers tempted [me], by proving [me], and saw my works forty years.

10.text: Wherefore I was wroth with this generation, and said, They always err in heart; and they have not known my ways;

11.text: so I swore in my wrath, If they shall enter into my rest.

12.text: See, brethren, lest there be in any one of you a wicked heart of unbelief, in turning away from [the] living God.

13.text: But encourage yourselves each day, as long as it is called To-day, that none of you be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin.

14.text: For we are become companions of the Christ if indeed we hold the beginning of the assurance firm to the end;

15.text: in that it is said, To-day if ye will hear his voice, do not harden your hearts, as in the provocation;

16.text: (for who was it, who, having heard, provoked? but [was it] not all who came out of Egypt by Moses?

17.text: And with whom was he wroth forty years? [Was it] not with those who had sinned, whose carcases fell in the wilderness?

18.text: And to whom sware he that they should not enter into his rest, but to those who had not hearkened to the word?

19.text: And we see that they could not enter in on account of unbelief;)
